author: murdocisgod
title: using games to scale audience
description: ADA needs to scale. A fun shooting game will bring in a larger gaming community to help scale.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge asks for proposals that will help Cardano scale, to secure Cardano main chain is not overloaded as new protocols in DeFi, NFTs and gaming are being released. 

Challenge encourages proposals within the following scalability topic areas:
- Rollups (e.g. zero knowledge rollups, optimistic rollups)
- Sharding
- Sidechains
- State channels

The proposal seeks to develop a game to enable gamers to earn money and own their assets bought or won inside the games. This is a great idea, and is a perfect fit for blockchain technology. This challenge is not about game development however, but how to scale the Cardano blockchain to make the platform withstand and support higher and higher loads in the coming years. The proposal does not set out to solve any of the scalability areas mentioned in the challenge description. This fact was also commented by a community user during the ideation phase, but the proposal was unfortunately left in this challenge instead of being moved to the "Gamers On - Chained". 

I strongly disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, and rate this to 1. This is unfortunate as it would have been given a higher Impact rating if it had been proposed in a gaming related challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer mentions background from prior game development in one of the comments to the proposal, but no evidence like links or references are provided. The proposer knows the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal. The list of resources contains for the most part traditional game development roles, but I would have liked to see some roles with blockchain experience. Blockchain research is mentioned in the plan, but no mention is given to who will do the research and who will develop the blockchain integration of the game. The team is not an existing team, but the proposer is planning to team up with a game development company to do the development. Which company is not mentioned in the proposal. Would suggest more details about team to be provided in a future proposal.

Budget is for 1 year, and not enough to be able to complete the full development of the game. The proposer says more funds will be requested in later Catalyst funds. The funding is mentioned as a risk by the proposer, and will be mitigated by requesting funds. 

The proposal says game development will take 3 years to complete, but the time table only show activities for 1 year. The last activity being "Finish development" and "Relase". In a future resubmit of this proposal, I would suggest making the time table and budget for completion of the roadmap (all 3 years), and show the plan for completing the delivery of the proposal with usable part-deliverables from each completed phase/proposal to ensure something is given back to the community. Part-deliverables that can be used by the community, a pilot of the game, with minimal functionality for example, will also be more likely to receive funds for future proposals / phases than if no deliverables are made by the project. 

I think making adjustments to the proposal and taking into account the feedback I give, will make this proposal get higher Feasibility rating than currently possible to give. I disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully as it is currently planned.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal says KPIs will be created according to the roadmap but is currently not specified in the proposal. The plan contains milestones and development phases for 1 year but no clearly identifiable measures of success like for example part delivery of small usable components or a pilot of the game.
In future proposal, I would recommend extending the propsal with measurable KPIs and usable part-deliverables so the community can measure project progress and success. As the proposal now stands, no deliverable seem to be returned to the community before completion of the game in 3 years.
I disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals

f6_assessments.q0:
The objectives in the Challenge setting are Hydra/Blockchain related. It was stated to seek alternative scaling solutions for "Novel ideas, Research, Extensions of Hydra functionality or porting over solutions used in other blockchains". The Brief also welcomes proposers to focus on market specific scalability solutions, e.g. "Defi specifically with DEXs as a focus area or other growing markets that could benefit from Novel Scaling Solutions", e.g. Rollups, Sharding, Sidechains, StateChannels.
_________________________________________________
Based on the Campaign Brief, I believe this Gaming Proposal, which may be a great game and, while targeting Consumer Scaling in a growing market is in the wrong challenge. It should be noted that in comments a post was made suggesting the same.
f6_assessments.q1:
The feasibility section of the proposal states that 'it is a spec and a more detailed roadmap.... would have to be established'. My suggestion would be that this proposal should have more depth to it to be considered complete. One item most notably is what are the actual years (20xx in proposal) of the roadmap.
____________________________________________________
I do not think this proposal would be successfully implemented. The budget request is for $90,000 yet the different budget breakdowns ( attachment and Proposal body) have vastly different sums. The proposal body budget breakdown is stated as "Approx Total $489,984" and an attached budget suggestion has different numbers. I would recommend to the proposer that a complete and accurate financial analysis of the project should be done and provided for community understanding. I would also strongly suggest the proposer include the teams experience, skills and experience in developing a project such as this.
f6_assessments.q2: The Success Vision of this proposal with its lack of KPIs and metrics do not meet the Challenge brief. My suggestion for the proposer in this category would be to clarify and quantify how the community could expect to measure project successes over the 3 years suggested it may take to build this game.

f6_assessments.q0: The author provides a great high level description of what is intended and what the final product would look like. The idea of using a popular play to earn game to increase interest and interaction with the Cardano blockchain certainly addresses a demand in the market as well as contributes to the expansion of Cardano reputation and name recognition. However, the creation of a game on the Cardano blockchain is not actually a “scaling solution” and so does not properly fit into this category. As I understand it, scaling solutions are pieces of technology that would allow for the network to run under heavier traffic loads - not merely client/investor acquisition.
f6_assessments.q1:
This project does not seem to be very feasible at all for this particular individual. Looking at the author’s history, it seems that they intend merely to submit as many “good ideas” to the Catalyst platform as possible, regardless of whether or not they are actually achievable targets. 

There is no outline of an actual team here, just a list of what it would cost to hire people. 

The asking cost is $90,000, which is very high for a project with no team, no deliverables and no proof of concept. 

There is also no mention of the author’s credentials as to what qualifies them as a game designer. 

The roadmap is so poorly constructed and vague that this proposal borders on outright fraud. It mentions months and months of “research”, and very little in the way of actual productions. It seems that this author wants to be paid large sums of money just to learn more about programming and/or the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: There are zero mentioned auditing methods here. There is only a reference to a “road map”, which is very high level and provides almost no detail as to what will actually be done and when. Asking for such a sum as $90,000 requires assurances that there will be a product actually delivered within a reasonable time frame, and I see no way of ensuring that will happen or any plan of proving such later on down the road.

f6_assessments.q0: The suggestion of using games to scale the audience would be better suited to the Gamers On - Chained challenge. The proponent offers the solution Make a fun 3d first-person/3rd person battle royal game with Blockchain gamefi features such as play to earn, defi components, and asset ownership intended for gamers. The impact from an A list quality game on the most decentralized network with blockchain gamefi features would bring in more industry-changing game development opportunities such as governance from people and not the company and bringing more ADA opportunities to gamers. In addition to this information, the proposal does not provide more information to better understand what objects the game will include and what tasks will be done? what will the rewards be like? the benefits of the participants such as how ?. The proponent mentioned a risk that there is not enough funding to develop this project for 3 years and offer a solution to apply for funding in the next funds. However, the proposal also does not specify what the development stages in 3 years, the proposal in fund 8 will perform.
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap and detailed project development plan are not clear, the proponent mentioned 20xx making it difficult for the reader to determine whether the task will be carried out this year or next year or will have different development stages. . The proposed cost is very large but not enough compared to the total project cost that the proponent needs. With the monthly amount to spend Total Monthly $46,400/Month, the proposed amount is not enough to meet in 2 months, so where will the rest of the money be taken? Have you raised capital or any sponsors?. Information about the team is not provided, it will be difficult to verify the identity, the proponent should add the information of key members to carry out the project as well as professional experience in this field.
f6_assessments.q2: Project success metrics have not been provided. Success has not been determined and no trials have been conducted. This proposal is a new one, the proponent has not been funded before

f6_assessments.q0: I personally feel the manifesto at hand seems to have misinterpreted the challenge at hand. The campaign brief clearly makes note of the proposal's requirement of solutions to handle the humungous volume of traffic over the chain and if possible look for an alternative to Hydra. But the proposer provides us a way of bringing in more traffic by drawing more people onto the chain using a game. This proposal has all the necessary traits of being triumphant provided it was submitted in other challenges such as "Gamers on-chained" or "Scale-Up Cardano's Community Hub". But this proposal does not fit the criteria of the "Cardano Scaling Solutions" campaign. However, looking at the bright side, this could surely be used as an approach to drive more traffic into the ecosystem and use the challenges it brings for testing the capabilities of other scaling solutions.
f6_assessments.q1:
Keeping only the feasibility in mind, the proposer makes no reservations in providing the community with an elucidated action plan with lucid milestones for their game development. Apart from that, I see no other credible information. The proposer makes a clear mention of the required team to get the proposal up and running but doesn't mention any existing team members or the expertise they already bring along. The budget also seems to be overestimated considering the entire fund allocation of 1M, this proposal is requesting around 50% of it. With no detailed milestones and team information, it is quite hard to determine the feasibility of the proposal and its likelihood of being implemented successfully.
I feel the proposer should go back to the drawing board and fill in the gaps and make an attempt in the upcoming rounds under a suitable campaign for this to successfully attract some votes from the community.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer hardly makes an effort to provide the community with any plausible metrics that could assist in the audit process. With such a huge fund request, it is expected to come with some quantifiable metrics that could track its timely progress. However, the proposer fails to provide any such KPIs and also provides a vague point on how success would look, which makes the readers doubtful about the impact and effect the game would have on the ecosystem. A dainty more information to shed light on how the community can monitor the implementation and the success of the proposal would do the trick. But at the moment, considering a lot of information missing, I feel 1 out of 5 would do it justice and I suggest the proposer make adjustments and provide some metrics such as number of gamers registered, number of daily users, amount of ADA collected through fees and etcetera would gain the trust and attention of the community
